intro: Malus sieboldii var. arborescens, commonly known as the Japanese flowering crabapple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring showy clusters of white or pink flowers in early spring. The plant has elliptical leaves that turn yellow in autumn, adding to its seasonal appeal. It typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. This variety is prized for its compact growth and is often used in gardens for its aesthetic beauty.
